title: Colombia's President Stands Up to Trump's Words
summary: In South America, Colombia is a country next to Venezuela. The United States and Colombia are usually friends, but President Trump from the U.S. has said mean things about Colombia's President Gustavo Petro. Trump says Petro is involved with drugs, but there is no proof. Petro used to be a fighter in a group called M-19, but he stopped fighting in the 1990s. Now, Petro says he will protect Colombia if it is attacked. Many people in Colombia think Trump is being unfair and trying to control their country. They believe every country should make its own decisions without interference. This situation is making things tense between the two countries.

background_read: Colombia is a country in South America known for its coffee and beautiful landscapes. It has had a history of conflict with groups like guerrillas, but many people work for peace. The United States is a big country in North America that often works with other countries on issues like trade and security. Sometimes, leaders disagree, which can cause tension. Understanding how countries talk to each other helps us learn about friendship and respect in the world.
Article_Structure: WHO: President Gustavo Petro of Colombia and President Trump of the United States.
WHAT: Trump accuses Petro of drug ties without proof, and Petro defends Colombia.
WHERE: This is happening between Colombia and the United States, with news from Bogota.
WHY: To show how leaders disagree and protect their countries' rights.

perspectives.description: Many Colombians see Trump's threats as unfair and colonial, believing Colombia should be independent.
